snippet: An estimated 75,000 state and federal prisoners are held in solitary confinement in the United States. This is too many, President Obama argues.
abstract: Critics of solitary confinement welcome Pres Obama's condemnation of practice during his speech at NAACP in Philadelphia; speech follows order from Obama directing Justice Dept to review solitary confinement, which affects estimated 75,000 state and federal prisoners nationwide.

byline.original: By PETER BAKER and ERICA GOODE
byline.contributor: Peter Baker reported from Washington, and Erica Goode from New York.

lead_paragraph: An estimated 75,000 state and federal prisoners are held in solitary confinement in the United States. This is too many, President Obama argues.

headline.main: Critics of Solitary Confinement Are Buoyed as Obama Embraces Their Cause
headline.print_headline: Critics of Solitary Confinement Are Buoyed as Obama Embraces Their Cause
